issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: The problem described is an issue which will never be fixed.
resolution.name: Won't Fix

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: Log file isn't created even though it's specified in the config file.
fields.summary: CodeProcessor: logging to a file is broken

comments.body:
Long story short, winston sucks. I can't seem to fix this issue, plus logging to a file has some, shall we say, "quirks"

Also worth noting, this only happens when runs are interrupted and the process hasn't been running long. It seems like it doesn't have a chance to flush to a file. I think it's safe to ignore this issue until we rip out winston from everything and replace it with something in node-appc (or a separate module entirely)
